details.description: Come unplug, relax, and experience a cup of serenity at the Pauline Tea-Bar Apothecary! Sip or purchase an herbal tea, spend time in contemplative solace, or experience creative play with a friend or group! Also register for one of our holistic classes and gain greater clarity or nourishment for your soul!

raw_data.name: The Pauline Tea-Bar Apothecary
raw_data.full_address: 2326 Arty Ave, Charlotte, NC 28208, United States

reviews_data.review_text: What a vibe! This place lives up to every bit of the hype - I truly cannot remember the last time I felt that relaxed having tea outside of my home. I’ll be back for sure.

This place is Amazing, if I will stop at amazing then that's not enough. It's a heaven for tea lovers. This place has a theme, a soothing atmosphere. Every sip of tea will brings a smile on your face. Loved it
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for experiencing our sweet tea room; can't wait to have you back!

reviews_data.review_text: Enjoyed myself here! I loved picking out my tea cup a little too much 😂 Can’t wait to come back
reviews_data.owner_answer: Kodili, thank you for the sweet review.  Come back soon!

reviews_data.review_text: What a cute space!!!!! If it’s black owned, I’m supporting and Pauline’s checked every box from an experience level. From the moment you walk in, you’re met with this warm feeling as if you’re stepping into your granny’s house. Everything is one of a kind from the furniture, seating and even the tea cups that the drinks are served in. The host behind the counter was welcoming and extremely patient as she helped us navigate their menu. The tea we enjoyed was sooo fragrant and flavorful and stood alone without anything added to it. Even the tea we purchased permeated the car in a pleasant way on our ride home. From a service and product quality perspective, everything was a 10/10! Pauline’s is a special community gem and worth the visit hands down.

A lovely, welcoming place. Went on a rainy day so a friend and I had this cozy tea shop to ourselves; a rarity, I'm told. The owner, Sherri, was so attentive, curating our tea experience with the same care she's clearly given the space. Cannot wait to return--not just for her delightful teas but to enjoy her many mugs and dainty cups! I hope to catch the live music or a wine night next time, maybe a high tea!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Ahhhh, Sarah! How sweet of you to remember us - by posting this detailed review.  It was delight to read, and THANK YOU! Hope to see you again soon. - Sherry

reviews_data.review_text: I LOVE ❤️ 😍 this place! So peaceful and welcoming.  The atmosphere calms my spirit and warms my heart.  I always get my pastry heated up just a little...oh..and golden milk and warm honey are a MUST in my turmeric tea!! I also love the refreshing cold teas with mint during the summer ☀️  Sherry and her staff are amazing! Go to Pauline's and get you a little slice of peace and respite, especially during these times!

I had a great time, loved the ambience. I enjoyed 2 large pots of Jasmine tea accompanied each time with a pastry. I had blueberry muffin and lemon cake. I had a delightful relaxing afternoon there and I can’t wait to come back:)
reviews_data.owner_answer: Aimee, thank you for the sweet review! We look forward to having you back in our lovely tea lounge again soon.

reviews_data.review_text: Luscious licorice is my new favorite tea

A warm, comfortable, serene atmosphere with a wide selection of tea. A great place to relax, connect with friends and de-stress. Great service and food. Even a prayer closet is available to foster spirituality.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you for embracing the intention of our beloved tea lounge, Joyce.  Hope to see you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Cute, quaint tea bar that you may frequently pass by off of Wilkinson. Perfect for small meetings, girl talk, doing work on laptop, or in my case listening to an audiobook. The environment was like sitting in your grandma's living room (cozy and warm). There were books to read, magazines to scroll through, and even a zen garden you can explore. The tea flavors seemed delightful, I loved the cinnamon with honey. The presentation of the tea was classy. The treats looked delicious, but I didn't try one yet. Oh, I'm coming back.
reviews_data.owner_answer: We can't wait for you to come back, Yolanda; and thank you for the kind review!  Expect more savory treats & dessert options soon.

reviews_data.review_text: I absolutely loved my experience here and foresee many more visits in my future. Located conveniently close to my office, it offers a much-needed peaceful retreat from the daily hustle. It's the ideal place for me to clear my head, brainstorm new ideas, or just reset before finishing my workday. The service was not only very friendly but also remarkably fast. My energizing tea was the perfect boost to help me complete my tasks.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Chris, it was such a surprise to see you walk in to the tea-bar today! Thank you for the warm affirmation of our sacred community lounge, and hope to see you again soon.

reviews_data.review_text: Stopped in for a cup of tea with my friend and had the best time here! It was warm and inviting and the owner, Sherri, was so welcoming and kind! I will definitely return!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Carina, YOU are a gem! Thank you for being a witness to the magical encounter of this sacred space.  We look forward to hosting you all again soon! -Sherry

reviews_data.review_text: I came in feeling stressed and looking for a natural way to unwind. The owner was kind and helpful, guiding me to the perfect loose-leaf tea and sweetener. The space is calming, with a meditation room that adds to the healing atmosphere. It was exactly what I needed to reset. Highly recommend for anyone on a wellness journey or simply looking for high-quality tea.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you, Bri! Appreciate the kind review, and come back soon.  Heal well, friend!

reviews_data.review_text: This has been my go-to tea bar for years! Nothing like it anywhere else in Charlotte. Get thee a cup and let them bring your glorious tea to your soon to be favorite spot.

reviews_data.review_text: After an exhaustive week Pauline’s Tea Bar & Apothecary was the perfect antidote! Such an oasis of calm and serenity, in a beautifully decorated setting, I felt its calming effect almost immediately. Her extensive selection of specialty teas and treats were tasty and sitting in the comfortable surroundings was a balm for the week I had. I’m now ready to face whatever comes my way! Visit Pauline’s and get your equilibrium back! ❤️
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you for this beautiful review and your joyFULL spirit, Allison!

reviews_data.review_text: Love the whole concept of this place! If I had a shop it would be just like this, cozy kind vibes, different fun events, you choose your own cute tea cup, so many delicious options for teas and pastries ( my favorite is the cinnamon orange and lemon cake ) and compassionate great customer service! I love to come unplug and journal, read or update my calendar / planner for the week!

reviews_data.review_text: Great place, great atmosphere to disconnect and enjoy tea and a light lunch

reviews_data.review_text:
Hmm not sure what’s going on today. Usually my service here is 10/10 but my most recent visit was very discombobulated. I had to correct my receipt, ask for my pastries, ask for sugar, my pot spout was broken & I didn’t get a spoon…I also usually get a fairly cohesive tea set based on the cup I select, but today’s set was a bit thrown together. I’ll still be returning, as this is a lovely tea spot, but I hope they can maintain such high levels of service as they grow in tenure.

Following up: I’ve visited the tea bar again and even hosted my parents here during the holidays—they absolutely loved it! The service was excellent, and we had a wonderful time. I’m happy to be a long-time patron and look forward to many more visits!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Amanda, thank you for the note & your continued support.  Gracious hospitality WITH EXCELLENCE is what we should always be striving for; and I'll be sure we huddle about your experience this week.  Peace & Blessings -Sherry, Owner

reviews_data.review_text:
I can't remember the last time I looked forward to submitting a review this much. I've been meaning to stop by for a while, but there's always a conflict with my work schedule. I finally made it yesterday, Saturday  12-23-23.

The vibe was serene the moment I stepped inside. I'm not sure what I smelled as I was getting ready to order, but I thought for sure I smelled a hint of ginger. The young lady who took my order was pleasant and eager to answer my questions being a first timer. The menu is extensive, especially if you love tea. I liked that there was also a description of both the tea ingredients and how it benefits you. The other lady (assumed it was the owner) was just as pleasant.

I ordered lemon ginger tea and macaroons. Both were delicious as I sipped and took bites while writing in my journal. I was on my way to visit nursing home residents and spread some holiday cheer. This was a perfect way to get in a little self care.

I couldn't stay as long as I wanted to. If it were up to me, I'd have stayed until they closed at 4 pm. They'll be closed from December 24 - January 1, so I know it was God's will for me to go & have this experience to end 2023. As if I couldn't be wooed any more, I stumbled across the prayer room as I was leaving. I can't wait to return in 2024! I anticipate it being one of my tranquility Saturday spots in the new year.
reviews_data.owner_answer: We are so glad that you came in and became enraptured with our sacred space.  Accepting community folk - like you - has made curated our tea lounge so special! We can't wait to have you back. - Peace & Further Blessings, Sherry

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful place! It was so inviting and the tea was delicious. The owner was kind and helpful. Definitely coming back!

reviews_data.review_text: I chose this place without knowing what it was truly about because I was looking for a place to be with myself that wasn’t surrounded by alcohol or caffeine. The amount of love poured into this place is profound and something to be celebrated and supported. I will be back and will recommend to any and everybody. Thank you for sharing this sanctuary with us.

reviews_data.review_text: A must stop for Charlotte. The establishment gives you a feeling similar to a warm, cozy house and the tea was bold yet soothing. Highly recommend!

reviews_data.review_text: Fantastic and special place. The space is peaceful and welcoming. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. reviews_data.review_text: Very cozy and unique tea bar.  Comfortable  sitting to allow for chat or there are individual chairs and outside seating.  Prayer room is offered. Teas are very aromatic.  Tea desserts are available  for purchase.   Shop also highlights local artists

reviews_data.review_text: Lovely place with delicious teas and the sweetest people. During our time there, It was clear that this place is like an oasis for the community. reviews_data.review_text: Went here for the first time today. And wow, what a great experience!  I came in for a holiday gift and stayed for some tea myself. Very cozy and inviting atmosphere. The shop also offers bites to eat, plenty of books, and beautiful art. Will definitely be back!

reviews_data.review_text: I can't even say this is Charlotte's best kept secret because more and more people are learning about Pauline's everyday! Lol! I learned forever ago that if you find a good things - share it with everyone. I personally LOVE everything about Paulines - Sherry, Ilona, and Danielle are such sweethearts. They treat everyone like a superstar and who doesn't need that in life? <3 If you're looking for a nurturing environment to read, relax, unplug, work or connect with friends - this is where you need to be.

We are delighted that you've chosen to collaborate with us with your beautiful journal writing sessions at our Pauline fellowship table. reviews_data.review_text: This place is magical, the innerG here is amazing! The location and ambiance is amazing. It’s so quaint and cozy. The idea of such a sacred space to compliment such a well intentioned space! If you love tea and good innerG this is your spot!!! It just may be a the house of love and healing!

reviews_data.review_text: Great place

reviews_data.review_text:

Although I arrived close to closing, I definitely plan to return again soon to get the full experience.

Please do come back and spend the day experiencing our restorative environment! We appreciate your kind words and the high review. Peace & Further Blessings, -Sherry

reviews_data.review_text:
This is a wonderful space and! I'm glad Charlotte has it it. I immediately felt welcomed walking in here. Background muisc was just right. I love  the  different types of decor and of seating available. The art throught the space is all local too- love the community support. All the beagizil teacups and teapots ! They infused sugar cubes which I will have to come back and try for sure. There also so nakery items and chips to pair with your tea. You can do a cup or a pot of tea. This is the original location; a second location just opened definitely will try and visit.

The 1st Friday of the month there is live music so I'll have to check out th calendar for 2022.

Out goodie bags came with samples but I also bought a tea tin- comes with 1oz of your tea of choice.

Very pleasant experience after a long day at work.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Vicki, we're glad that you came through! Thank you for all of the kinds words of support! We'll see you again soon.

reviews_data.review_text:
Anytime is tea time in my book ! This place is so cute & right  up my alley . This place is a whole vibe , & in my case a whole vibe outside . I opted to sit outside on the cute patio set since it’s a nice day. They were very informative about explaining the different teas & what they were good for . I chose the flower power tea .

I had the whole experience with the ceramic tea set and instead of crumpets & pastries I had some sort of sweet potato bread that was insanely good . Something so small packed a lot of flavor & punch . Do note it’s  a small prayers room that I absolutely love ❤️. I’ll definitely be visiting this tea bar often .
reviews_data.owner_answer: Shionda, thank you for the precious words and compliments that you shared.  We hope to have your gracious presence back in our tea room soon!

reviews_data.review_text:
This is a great place to meet old friends and new. Sherry provides a sacred and calm place for all people to enjoy.  I have never been a tea drinker, but she sold me.  I am there every Saturday because of the customer service and conversation. The mood is on chill and the atmosphere is welcoming.

I saw a post from a group that tried to host a party and take over the spot. I was there, they were so wrong and did not understand the assignment.

Sherry you keep doing what you do.  Selah and Amen.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Al, thank you for being one of our treasured tea-bar patrons and for always being generous with your love and support.  Peace & Further Blessings, friend!

reviews_data.review_text:
This very small YET COMFORTING environment I would never recommend for a party bc it’s not a venue that fits more than 20 maximum. And if you checked them out first. Your experience would have let you known that this is a mediation place and not a party joint. I’m a peace seeker and HAVE FOUND THAT AT Pauline’s. So if you’re loud boisterous or obnoxious then you need to be partying in a club. And the negative reviews reflect exactly why this didn’t go well for you. So please don’t recommend any of your friends or family that have those attitude and unfortunately it’s a lot of us Black women that do this. STOP IT.
GIVE PAULINE’S TEA APOTHECARY A TRY. I WILL FOR AT LEAST ONCE A WEEK. For  as long as I drink tea😉THE TEAS ARE AWESOME. IF YOU KNOW TEAS. THEN YOU KNOW. IF you don’t then you’ll think not.
LET US SIP ☕️TO PEACE LOVE AND LIGHT

EMPRYSS AND I WILL SEE YOU SOON
BLESSINGS
Nadyne
reviews_data.owner_answer: Nadyne, thank you for your affirming words of love and support.  I receive.  Gratefully, the tea-bar has had some very successful small group gatherings, who went through the process of reserving and renting the space for their party/celebration.  As you noted, just popping in for a party experience isn't going to go well for all.  We're not a chain restaurant venue; it is truly hallowed space.  Peace, Love and FURTHER Blessings - Beautiful one!

reviews_data.review_text: My first experience here was terrible. I did not feel welcome, nor did my party. The woman who spoke to us was very condescending. She made us feel as though we were "less than", which came as a shock since we were trying to support a black owned business. It may be black owned but it felt like "white only" was preferred.  I'm not a tea connoisseur, but of all the teas I sampled not one was good. They also took 20 minutes to bring a bottle a water and we had to repeatedly ask them to restock the sugar. I definitely would not recommend this establishment.

Came in today for my sisters birthday party which was a small gathering. The owner was very condescending and made us feel like we didn’t belong there. I really wanted to support a black owned business but WILL NOT BE BACK TO THIS LOCATION.
Would not recommend, came in for a tea party today and did not feel welcome. So disappointed in the service we experience today.
Sherry and her daughter go out of their way to create a relaxed atmosphere to enjoy the full experience. He knowledge of tea and compliments are extensive. A bucket list stop for Charlotte

reviews_data.review_text: What a vibe! This place lives up to every bit of the hype - I truly cannot remember the last time I felt that relaxed having tea outside of my home. I’ll be back for sure.

This place is Amazing, if I will stop at amazing then that's not enough. It's a heaven for tea lovers. This place has a theme, a soothing atmosphere. Every sip of tea will brings a smile on your face. Loved it

reviews_data.review_text: What a cute space!!!!! If it’s black owned, I’m supporting and Pauline’s checked every box from an experience level. From the moment you walk in, you’re met with this warm feeling as if you’re stepping into your granny’s house. Everything is one of a kind from the furniture, seating and even the tea cups that the drinks are served in. The host behind the counter was welcoming and extremely patient as she helped us navigate their menu. The tea we enjoyed was sooo fragrant and flavorful and stood alone without anything added to it. Even the tea we purchased permeated the car in a pleasant way on our ride home. From a service and product quality perspective, everything was a 10/10! Pauline’s is a special community gem and worth the visit hands down.

A lovely, welcoming place. Went on a rainy day so a friend and I had this cozy tea shop to ourselves; a rarity, I'm told. The owner, Sherri, was so attentive, curating our tea experience with the same care she's clearly given the space. Cannot wait to return--not just for her delightful teas but to enjoy her many mugs and dainty cups! I hope to catch the live music or a wine night next time, maybe a high tea!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Ahhhh, Sarah! How sweet of you to remember us - by posting this detailed review.  It was delight to read, and THANK YOU! Hope to see you again soon. - Sherry

reviews_data.review_text: I LOVE ❤️ 😍 this place! So peaceful and welcoming.  The atmosphere calms my spirit and warms my heart.  I always get my pastry heated up just a little...oh..and golden milk and warm honey are a MUST in my turmeric tea!! I also love the refreshing cold teas with mint during the summer ☀️  Sherry and her staff are amazing! Go to Pauline's and get you a little slice of peace and respite, especially during these times!

I had a great time, loved the ambience. I enjoyed 2 large pots of Jasmine tea accompanied each time with a pastry. I had blueberry muffin and lemon cake. I had a delightful relaxing afternoon there and I can’t wait to come back:)
reviews_data.owner_answer: Aimee, thank you for the sweet review! We look forward to having you back in our lovely tea lounge again soon.

reviews_data.review_text: Cute, quaint tea bar that you may frequently pass by off of Wilkinson. Perfect for small meetings, girl talk, doing work on laptop, or in my case listening to an audiobook. The tea flavors seemed delightful, I loved the cinnamon with honey. The presentation of the tea was classy. The treats looked delicious, but I didn't try one yet. Oh, I'm coming back.

I’ll still be returning, as this is a lovely tea spot, but I hope they can maintain such high levels of service as they grow in tenure.

reviews_data.review_text:
I can't remember the last time I looked forward to submitting a review this much. I've been meaning to stop by for a while, but there's always a conflict with my work schedule. I finally made it yesterday, Saturday  12-23-23.

The vibe was serene the moment I stepped inside. I'm not sure what I smelled as I was getting ready to order, but I thought for sure I smelled a hint of ginger. The young lady who took my order was pleasant and eager to answer my questions being a first timer. The menu is extensive, especially if you love tea. I liked that there was also a description of both the tea ingredients and how it benefits you. The other lady (assumed it was the owner) was just as pleasant.

I ordered lemon ginger tea and macaroons. Both were delicious as I sipped and took bites while writing in my journal. I was on my way to visit nursing home residents and spread some holiday cheer. This was a perfect way to get in a little self care.

I couldn't stay as long as I wanted to. If it were up to me, I'd have stayed until they closed at 4 pm. They'll be closed from December 24 - January 1, so I know it was God's will for me to go & have this experience to end 2023. Anytime is tea time in my book ! This place is so cute & right  up my alley . This place is a whole vibe , & in my case a whole vibe outside . I opted to sit outside on the cute patio set since it’s a nice day. They were very informative about explaining the different teas & what they were good for . I chose the flower power tea .

I had the whole experience with the ceramic tea set and instead of crumpets & pastries I had some sort of sweet potato bread that was insanely good . Something so small packed a lot of flavor & punch . Do note it’s  a small prayers room that I absolutely love ❤️. I’ll definitely be visiting this tea bar often .
reviews_data.owner_answer: Shionda, thank you for the precious words and compliments that you shared.  We hope to have your gracious presence back in our tea room soon!

reviews_data.review_text:
This is a great place to meet old friends and new. Sherry provides a sacred and calm place for all people to enjoy.  I have never been a tea drinker, but she sold me.  I am there every Saturday because of the customer service and conversation. The mood is on chill and the atmosphere is welcoming.

I saw a post from a group that tried to host a party and take over the spot. I was there, they were so wrong and did not understand the assignment.

Sherry you keep doing what you do.  Selah and Amen.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Al, thank you for being one of our treasured tea-bar patrons and for always being generous with your love and support.  Peace & Further Blessings, friend!

reviews_data.review_text:
This very small YET COMFORTING environment I would never recommend for a party bc it’s not a venue that fits more than 20 maximum. And if you checked them out first. Your experience would have let you known that this is a mediation place and not a party joint. I’m a peace seeker and HAVE FOUND THAT AT Pauline’s. So if you’re loud boisterous or obnoxious then you need to be partying in a club. And the negative reviews reflect exactly why this didn’t go well for you. So please don’t recommend any of your friends or family that have those attitude and unfortunately it’s a lot of us Black women that do this. STOP IT.
GIVE PAULINE’S TEA APOTHECARY A TRY. I WILL FOR AT LEAST ONCE A WEEK. For  as long as I drink tea😉THE TEAS ARE AWESOME. IF YOU KNOW TEAS. THEN YOU KNOW. IF you don’t then you’ll think not.
LET US SIP ☕️TO PEACE LOVE AND LIGHT

EMPRYSS AND I WILL SEE YOU SOON
BLESSINGS
Nadyne
reviews_data.owner_answer: Nadyne, thank you for your affirming words of love and support.  I receive.  Gratefully, the tea-bar has had some very successful small group gatherings, who went through the process of reserving and renting the space for their party/celebration.  As you noted, just popping in for a party experience isn't going to go well for all.  We're not a chain restaurant venue; it is truly hallowed space.  Peace, Love and FURTHER Blessings - Beautiful one!

reviews_data.review_text: My first experience here was terrible. I did not feel welcome, nor did my party. The woman who spoke to us was very condescending. She made us feel as though we were "less than", which came as a shock since we were trying to support a black owned business. It may be black owned but it felt like "white only" was preferred.  I'm not a tea connoisseur, but of all the teas I sampled not one was good. They also took 20 minutes to bring a bottle a water and we had to repeatedly ask them to restock the sugar. I definitely would not recommend this establishment.

Came in today for my sisters birthday party which was a small gathering. The owner was very condescending and made us feel like we didn’t belong there. I really wanted to support a black owned business but WILL NOT BE BACK TO THIS LOCATION.
Would not recommend, came in for a tea party today and did not feel welcome. So disappointed in the service we experience today.
Sherry and her daughter go out of their way to create a relaxed atmosphere to enjoy the full experience. He knowledge of tea and compliments are extensive. A bucket list stop for Charlotte
reviews_data.owner_answer: Terri, thank YOU for the warm words of affirmation! It was great to have you and your friend in our sacred space last Saturday.  Peace & Further Blessings to you, Beautiful one!

This place is an experience. Sherry Waters, the owner and hostess barista and master of ceremonies, is a local treasure who has collaborated with family and community to open this hearth space.

Natural light and greenery abounds here. If you dont have a book, there are plenty here to raise your vibe and the clientele is lively and warm. There are also nooks to be to yourself.

Oh! And these are great loose leaf teas; I usually have what Sherry is having because she has a way with using teas to bring balance. There are often tasty vegan and gluten free options for the baked choices and a couple of dairy free milks (SCORE!).
